intro: Conomorpha tamana, commonly known as the Tamana conomorpha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
